column4: Im going to use Virtual Box to install M$ XP if i pull this off I shouldn't need to dual boot any more, however how much Ram should I assign to XP? Ive got 2GB and 1GB swap for ubuntu so how much of that can i give to XP?
give it 700 if you want a random but reasonable number
bascule: 0o You're being serious? XP runs on like 256 minimum dont know how well that is when using virtaul box but why 700-768 Ram? isin't that a tad toooo much?
it will create as many as you tell it
ok just making sure the command was right
well, in the command you gave, you put spaces where none belong
yah but i thought i need spaces im creating three folder or more in the same directory, if not how would i do it, do i have to cd into the actual directory?
no, you just type mkdir /media/foldername1 /media/foldername2 /media/foldername3
which is not what you typed above
that is so true didnt notice that was an error but thanx for spotting it
ahh got beaten to it and in fashion
looks more or less ok to me, i'm not so familiar with fstab and mount options to say "it's perfect", though
that is what i also think but will try it out now, is there a way i can make fstab refresh without restarting my system?
mount -a
erUSUL: thank you
will look at it
amsn possibly, but i'm not sure
i ahve amsn but can't get voice chat, just find it too hard
do you know of anyother apps that could do the job
no, but i'm pretty sure Ctrl+G will list it

Alt + whatever key combo you need to use to type /
